result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Morgan D Golden

records.addlTxt: Court is down December 2, 2022; case rescheduled for plea/sentencing for January 12, 2023 at 1:30 pm; both parties agreed to date and time, via email.

Defendant Morgan D Golden not in court, in custody. Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw Ii in court for Morgan D Golden. Defendant's appearance waived. Attorney Grace M. Gall in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference. Defense requested plea and sentencing date. Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 36. Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Morgan D Golden in court, in custody.  Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw Ii in court for Morgan D Golden.  Attorney Grace M. Gall in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Bail motion by defense argued and DENIED by the Court. 
Cash Bond previously set remains . All conditions remain the same. Discovery and offer received. Defense requests status conference date. Court grants defense's request. Case is adjourned to Br. 36.
Status conference scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Morgan D Golden not in court, in custody.  Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw Ii in court for Morgan D Golden.  Attorney Alexandria Carlson in court on behalf of Grace Gall for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a scheduling conference. Defendant's appearance is waived. Defense filed a bail motion. Due to short notice, State is not in compliance with Victim's Rights Law to proceed on the bail motion. Court adjourns matter. Case remains calendared in Branch 36.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Motion to Modify Terms of Bond, filed.

Defendant Morgan D Golden in court with attorney William Anthony Rakestraw.  Defendant Morgan D Golden in custody at HOC.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Morgan D Golden appeared by video means with Attorney.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Judge Crivello, Branch 36. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 36.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver.  Received and Filed.  nk

Defendant Morgan D Golden not in court, defendant in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for preliminary hearing. States witness is present. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. State requests that this matter be set for a State V. Lee hearing or status; denied.  Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
  No driving without a valid license.

CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD DUE TO TECHNICAL DIFFICULTIES: 
 Defendant Morgan D Golden in court with attorney Joan Elizabeth Zawikowski.  Defendant Morgan D Golden in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
